intro: Urostachys coreanus, commonly known as Korean rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its foliage is characterized by narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to its harsh, alpine habitat.
